thread.title: Huntingdon thrashes Ferrum 56-21, White breaks interception record
thread.title_full: Huntingdon thrashes Ferrum 56-21, White breaks interception record

author: Matthew Copeland
title: Huntingdon thrashes Ferrum 56-21, White breaks interception record
text:
Huntingdon thrashes Ferrum 56-21, White breaks interception reco - WSFA.com Montgomery Alabama news. Member Center: Huntingdon thrashes Ferrum 56-21, White breaks interception record Posted: BASSETT, VA (WSFA) - 
Huntingdon extended their winning streak to three Saturday after clobbering Ferrum 56-21 in Bassett, VA. 
The two teams played a close, competitive first half, but the Hawks put up six seconds half touchdowns to beat the Panthers. 
Huntingdon struck early in the first quarter with a 6-yard run by John Iwaniec on their first drive. 
Late in the first quarter, Huntingdon's Jay Ware rushed for a 5-yard touchdown, capping a 13-play, 75 yard drive. The touchdown extended Huntingdon's lead to 14-0. 
On the ensuing drive, Ferrum answered with a touchdown of their own. Quarterback Troy Helton connected with Antonio Parker for a 24-yard touchdown pass, cutting the lead to seven. 
After forcing Huntingdon to turn the ball over on downs, the Panthers knotted the score at 14 after running back Samuel Martin rushed for a 4-yard touchdown. 
The teams remained tied at 14 going to halftime. 
Huntingdon came firing out of the gate in the second half. 
On the fifth play of the third quarter, Brendon Brown connected with Darius Dawsey for a 32-yard touchdown. 
About midway through the quarter, the Hawks scored again with a 20-yard run by Brown to extend their lead to 14. 
Huntingdon scored once more in the third quarter with a one-yard touchdown run from John Iwaniec to bring the score to 35-14 going into the final quarter. 
Huntingdon added two early fourth quarter touchdown runs from Jay Ware and Vic Jerald to increase their lead 35. 
The Panthers answered back on the ensuing drive with a 32-yard touchdown pass from Anthony Merritt to Chris Guy to bring the score to 49-21. 
Jerald added a late touchdown to seal the 56-14 victory for the Hawks. 
It was a stellar game for Huntingdon's offense, who put 556 yards in total offense. Almost 400 yards came from the ground. 
Defensively, the Hawks held Ferrum to 299 yards and forced three interceptions. 
Defensive back Anthony White recorded all three interceptions, breaking a single-game school record. 
Huntingdon improves to 4-1 in the 2015 campaign. Next week, the Hawks travel to Georgia to face LeGrange. Kickoff is slated for 5:00 p.m.
